alert.note: Alert for Creek; Okmulgee; Osage; Tulsa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 2:24AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Rogers, southeastern Osage, Creek, northwestern Wagoner, northwestern Okmulgee and Tulsa Counties through 315 AM CDT... At 224 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 2 miles west of Sperry to 4 miles northwest of Sapulpa to near Shamrock. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Sand Springs... Claremore... Bristow... Owasso... Bixby... Sapulpa... Jenks... Glenpool... Coweta... Skiatook... Catoosa... Verdigris... Mannford... Drumright... Inola... Kiefer... Sperry... Mounds... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 182 and 247. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for northeastern Oklahoma.
